CatDescriptText: Image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 8, 1947, pg. unknown [incomplete copy].  Portions of related article by Harold Keith published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, national edition, March 8, 1947, pg. 23, read: "Biased Policy of Automobile Club Hit by Jewish Writer...  After citing the AAA's boast that a protection to its members, but an asset and pride to the community as well, Goldman called attention to the bottom portion of the organization's application which reads, 'membership is open to white race.' ...Whether the group knows it or not, Charles (Teenie) Harris, 7604 Mulford Street, has been a member of the Pittsburgh Automobile Club for a year and two months.  Harris claimed that he received his insurance through a friend in a downtown concern as a Christmas gift."
TitMainTitle: Charles "Teenie" Harris self-portrait in Harris Studio
